tool_description: A WebAPI for match history is now available on Dota 2. Web developers can now retrieve the match history and match details in JSON or XML format for use in their own applications.
name: DOTA 2 Steam Web
title: DOTA 2 Steam Web

api_list.name: Match Details
api_list.description: To retrieve the specific details of a match, use this API:

required_parameters.name: matches_requested
required_parameters.description: Defaults is 25 matches, this can limit to less

optional_parameters.name: date_min
optional_parameters.description: date in UTC seconds since Jan 1, 1970 (unix time format)

optional_parameters.name: player_name
optional_parameters.description: Search matches with a player name, exact match only

optional_parameters.name: hero_id
optional_parameters.description: Search for matches with a specific hero being played, hero id's are in dota/scripts/npc/npc_heroes.txt in your Dota install directory

optional_parameters.name: skill
optional_parameters.description: 0 for any, 1 for normal, 2 for high, 3 for very high skill

optional_parameters.name: date_max
optional_parameters.description: date in UTC seconds since Jan 1, 1970 (unix time format)

optional_parameters.name: account_id
optional_parameters.description: Steam account id (this is not SteamID, its only the account number portion)

optional_parameters.name: start_at_match_id
optional_parameters.description: Start the search at the indicated match id, descending

api_list.name: Match History
api_list.description: will return the latest 25 public matches in JSON format. You can request it in XML format

optional_parameters.name: start_at_match_id
optional_parameters.description: To request the next 25, use the param "start_at_match_id" with one less than the last match number you received
